title: VILLAGE / POSSE 3
description: the end where you ask your final questions.

dialogueTree.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""I don't *want* to. But you discove..."
dialogueTree.text: "I don't *want* to. But you discovered a new species. And solved the murder..." He shrugs.

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""So I *have* to. Jude?""
links.text: "So I *have* to. Jude?"

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Anything that ends the *trial* is..."
links.text: "Anything that ends the *trial* is okay with me." A quick nod.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You haven't been drinking, she thin..."
links.text: You haven't been drinking, she thinks. So maybe this time...

links.title: Trant Heidelstam: ""Agreed. The public relations poten..."
links.text: "Agreed. The public relations potential of this is too valuable to let go."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Okay." He sighs. "We have vehicles..."
links.text: "Okay." He sighs. "We have vehicles in the square. And the perpetrator needs to be taken into custody. Let's go."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Now! Now you will *finally* get to..."
links.text: Now! Now you will *finally* get to know who you are!

links.title: You: ""Wait. I have a *few* questions bef..."
links.text: "Wait. I have a *few* questions before we go. About who I am."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: "The man looks westward, impatiently..."
links.text: The man looks westward, impatiently.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Jingling his car keys in his pocket..."
links.text: Jingling his car keys in his pocket.

links.title: You: ""Who *am* I?""
links.text: "Who *am* I?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Who *are* you? You're a gym teache..."
links.text: "Who *are* you? You're a gym teacher, Harry."

links.title: You: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Well -- obviously you're not a gym..."
links.text: "Well -- obviously you're not a gym teacher anymore, but..."

links.title: You: ""But before...""
links.text: "But before..."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Before you were a cop, you were a..."
links.text: "Before you were a cop, you were a gym teacher in Couron." She looks around. "It's getting really cold outside. Should we maybe..."

links.title: You: ""That does explain a lot.""
links.text: "That does explain a lot."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Harry... it explains *everything*...."
links.text: "Harry... it explains *everything*. The running around. The jumping. The *shot-put*. Your inexplicable facial hair..."

links.title: Cuno: ""No, pig, that explains *everything..."
links.text: "No, pig, that explains *everything*." The boy looks at you. "The running. The jumping. The *shot-put*. Your whack moustache..."

links.title: You: ""The FALN gear...""
links.text: "The FALN gear..."

links.title: Cuno: ""Your lame-ass pants before. Like t..."
links.text: "Your lame-ass pants before. Like this... fucking retro shit that's going on. Cuno's seen all this before -- in *gym* class..."

links.title: Cuno: ""Your lame taste in music. Like fro..."
links.text: "Your lame taste in music. Like from -- the Forties. Even the way you *stand* and stretch and shit... Cuno's seen this shit before. In *gym* class."

links.title: You: ""The collection of FALN sportswear..."
links.text: "The collection of FALN sportswear I've amassed..."

links.title: You: ""How I can run for *six hours* a da..."
links.text: "How I can run for *six hours* a day..."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "It explains everything. All the run..."
links.text: It explains everything. All the running around. The jumping. The *bicep girth*.

links.title: You: "The FALN gear..."
links.text: The FALN gear...

links.title: Physical Instrument: "The fact that you don't even know w..."
links.text: The fact that you don't even know what homo-sexuality is.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Some of your more *old-school* soci..."
links.text: Some of your more *old-school* social views. Your love of retro music.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "How you're able to perform a 360-de..."
links.text: How you're able to perform a 360-degree spin-kick despite your less than stellar workout routine.

links.title: Composure: "Your moves on the church floor -- w..."
links.text: Your moves on the church floor -- which -- let's be honest -- were mostly *jump aerobics*.

links.title: Composure: "Your posture. The constant *stretch..."
links.text: Your posture. The constant *stretches*... The disco star aspirations.

links.title: You: "The collection of FALN sportswear I..."
links.text: The collection of FALN sportswear I've amassed...

links.title: You: "How I can run for *five hours* a da..."
links.text: How I can run for *five hours* a day...

links.title: You: ""No way. I was a natural philosophe..."
links.text: "No way. I was a natural philosopher."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""You haven't told us about that --..."
links.text: "You haven't told us about that -- you've just told us about being a gym teacher."

links.title: You: ""A special forces gym teacher?""
links.text: "A special forces gym teacher?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""No," he remarks dryly, "a regular..."
links.text: "No," he remarks dryly, "a regular one."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "She's avoiding your gaze."
links.text: She's avoiding your gaze.

links.title: You: ""Really?""
links.text: "Really?"

links.title: Judit Minot: ""He's telling the truth. You were a..."
links.text: "He's telling the truth. You were a gym teacher in Couron." She looks around. "It's getting really cold outside. Should we maybe..."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Well -- now you're a cop," he paus..."
links.text: "Well -- now you're a cop," he pauses, "or... not anymore, so I guess you're a gym teacher again."

links.title: You: ""Why am I *like* this?""
links.text: "Why am I *like* this?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""It's not a mystery. Some chick fuc..."
links.text: "It's not a mystery. Some chick fucked you over. Also, you're a drunk."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "You really went with it too. Really..."
links.text: You really went with it too. Really maximized the damage.

links.title: You: ""Some chick -- who?""
links.text: "Some chick -- who?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Dora something. Dora Ingerlund?" H..."
links.text: "Dora something. Dora Ingerlund?" He thinks. "Yeah. You mentioned her name."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Not Dora *Du Bois*?"
links.text: Not Dora *Du Bois*?

links.title: You: ""Was she called Dora Du Bois?""
links.text: "Was she called Dora Du Bois?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Du Bois?" He shakes his head. "It..."
links.text: "Du Bois?" He shakes his head. "It was... Dora Ingerlund, I think. You've said her name. But you weren't married. You were engaged."

links.title: You: ""Wait, Dora Ingerlund?""
links.text: "Wait, Dora Ingerlund?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Something like that. Half-Vaasan.""
links.text: "Something like that. Half-Vaasan."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Vaasa is where beautiful and imposs..."
links.text: Vaasa is where beautiful and impossibly blonde people come from.

links.title: You: ""So we weren't even married...""
links.text: "So we weren't even married..."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""No one is married anymore. This is..."
links.text: "No one is married anymore. This is Revachol."

links.title: You: ""When was this?""
links.text: "When was this?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""God, I don't know..." He thinks. "..."
links.text: "God, I don't know..." He thinks. "Six years ago? She was way before my time."

links.title: Volition: "Six years and you haven't gotten ov..."
links.text: Six years and you haven't gotten over it, what the hell is wrong with you?

links.title: You: ""*SIX* years?""
links.text: "*SIX* years?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Yeah... Or seven? You're not doing..."
links.text: "Yeah... Or seven? You're not doing too good there. It's an old-man thing. Two *old-years* equals one normal year. That -- and Dora Ingerlund really tore you a new one. A big one."

links.title: You: ""Who was she?""
links.text: "Who was she?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Incredibly bangable?""
links.text: "Incredibly bangable?"

links.title: You: ""Are you *seriously* using this mom..."
links.text: "Are you *seriously* using this moment to assert male privilege!?!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He is very passionate about this.""
links.text: "He is very passionate about this."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Okay, you're right. She was extrem..."
links.text: "Okay, you're right. She was extremely fuckable, Harry. Gorgeous. A gorgeous bourgeois woman. Waifish. Like a *welkin* basically."

links.title: You: ""Huh?""
links.text: "Huh?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""She was extremely fuckable, Harry...."
links.text: "She was extremely fuckable, Harry. Gorgeous. A gorgeous bourgeois woman. Waifish. Like a *welkin* basically."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Snow Welkin. Blonde Welkin..."
links.text: Snow Welkin. Blonde Welkin...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Heartbreak Welkin."
links.text: Heartbreak Welkin.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Pain Welkin."
links.text: Pain Welkin.

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""I've only seen a picture -- but it..."
links.text: "I've only seen a picture -- but it's obvious you formed a real spiritual connection with how *pretty* she was. One you never recuperated from."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Look..." She turns to face the sea..."
links.text: "Look..." She turns to face the sea. "The sun is going down. It's time to go home."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""I think she taught in the Académie..."
links.text: "I think she taught in the Académie des Arts, east of the river. Way east. Hard to say which came first -- the middle class chick or the drink? Egg and the chicken kinda thing..."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""My point is, you need to see a *ps..."
links.text: "My point is, you need to see a *psychiatrist* about this shit. Not a psychologist -- several degrees harder. Is there's something harder than a psychiatrist?" He pauses to think. "A forensic psychiatrist. Go talk to that."

links.title: Rhetoric: "In other words -- he's heard *enoug..."
links.text: In other words -- he's heard *enough* about this.

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Look..." She turns to face the sea..."
links.text: "Look..." She turns to face the sea. "It's raining. It's time to go home."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Look..." She turns to face the sea..."
links.text: "Look..." She turns to face the sea. "It's about to rain soon. It's time to go home."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Look..." She turns to face the sea..."
links.text: "Look..." She turns to face the sea. "The sun is about to go down. It's time to go home."

links.title: You: ""Figures.""
links.text: "Figures."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Extremely fuckable, Harry. Gorgeou..."
links.text: "Extremely fuckable, Harry. Gorgeous. A gorgeous bourgeois woman. Waifish. Like a *welkin* basically."

links.title: You: ""No, I meant -- what did she do?""
links.text: "No, I meant -- what did she do?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""She was incredibly fuckable. A bea..."
links.text: "She was incredibly fuckable. A beautiful bourgeois woman. Waifish. Like a *welkin* basically."

links.title: You: ""*Now* I've heard enough.""
links.text: "*Now* I've heard enough."

links.title: You: ""Oh okay. Six years is not that muc..."
links.text: "Oh okay. Six years is not that much."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Yeah... You're not doing too good..."
links.text: "Yeah... You're not doing too good there. It's an old-man thing I think. Two *old-years* equals one normal year. That -- and Dora Ingerlund really tore you a new one. A big one."

links.title: You: ""It couldn't have been six. Three...."
links.text: "It couldn't have been six. Three. Let's go with three."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""No. It was six. Like *ancient*. It..."
links.text: "No. It was six. Like *ancient*. It's an old-man thing. Two *old-years* equals one normal year. That -- and Dora Ingerlund really tore you a new one. A big one."

links.title: You: ""I've heard enough." (End it.)"
links.text: "I've heard enough." (End it.)

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""So have I. You *bitterly* drop *De..."
links.text: "So have I. You *bitterly* drop *Dearest Dora* and *really tore me a new one*... twice a week I think? It comes up."

links.title: Trant Heidelstam: "The special consultant glances at h..."
links.text: The special consultant glances at his wrist-watch.

links.title: You: ""Was her name Dora?""
links.text: "Was her name Dora?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Yeah. Dora Ingerlund, I think.""
links.text: "Yeah. Dora Ingerlund, I think."

links.title: You: ""Okay. Am I a dirty cop working for..."
links.text: "Okay. Am I a dirty cop working for La Puta Madre?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: You: ""No? Because a suspect seemed to th..."
links.text: "No? Because a suspect seemed to think..."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""You're too unstable to work for a..."
links.text: "You're too unstable to work for a mob boss. You're suicidal, Harry. No mob boss would take you."

links.title: Trant Heidelstam: ""I assure you -- I wouldn't consult..."
links.text: "I assure you -- I wouldn't consult for a corrupt unit."

links.title: Logic: "He would immediately backpedal out..."
links.text: He would immediately backpedal out of it.

links.title: Volition: "I told you it's not that bad."
links.text: I told you it's not that bad.

links.title: You: ""Okay then.""
links.text: "Okay then."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Talks concluded?" She hugs herself..."
links.text: "Talks concluded?" She hugs herself for warmth.

links.title: You: ""Precinct 41... what kind of statio..."
links.text: "Precinct 41... what kind of station is it?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Us? We're the *Bloody Murder Stati..."
links.text: "Us? We're the *Bloody Murder Station*, haven't you heard? We're the bad guys. No one likes us."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's not true. Jamrock is too bi..."
links.text: "That's not true. Jamrock is too big for one precinct. You're just understaffed. And everyone respects the 41st -- you have Captain Pryce."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Thank you, lieutenant. You're bein..."
links.text: "Thank you, lieutenant. You're being kind. It *is* an understaffed station and the district *is* too big -- which is why we need to..." He tilts his head northward...

links.title: Judit Minot: ""... get back to it. We left Torson..."
links.text: "... get back to it. We left Torson and McLaine to run the C-Wing. It's not good."

links.title: You: ""Torson and McLaine?""
links.text: "Torson and McLaine?"

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Mack 'The Torso' Torson and Cheste..."
links.text: "Mack 'The Torso' Torson and Chester McLaine --" She arches an eyebrow. "They're not fit to run a wing. Believe me. Things are shaky as it is."

links.title: Conceptualization: "They *are* damn iconic though -- To..."
links.text: They *are* damn iconic though -- Torson and McLaine!

links.title: You: ""An iconic duo I take it?""
links.text: "An iconic duo I take it?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Yeah -- not like *us*. Two clinica..."
links.text: "Yeah -- not like *us*. Two clinically depressed old men. Where's the contrast here? We're garbage."

links.title: You: "Not now."
links.text: Not now.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Of course."
links.text: Of course.

links.title: You: ""And the C-Wing is...""
links.text: "And the C-Wing is..."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""God..." He sighs. "There are four..."
links.text: "God..." He sighs. "There are four wings, Harry: A, B, C, and D. We're in C. It's made of losers and clock-punchers. You and I *re-conceptualized* it as a task force. It was a mistake."

links.title: Trant Heidelstam: ""There's also a lot of outside help..."
links.text: "There's also a lot of outside help involved. Not only me." He smiles. "Other losers too."

links.title: Suggestion: "He's anything but a loser. Although..."
links.text: He's anything but a loser. Although he would like to be seen as one. It's cooler that way.

links.title: You: ""And Pryce is...""
links.text: "And Pryce is..."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Ptolemy Pryce? He's the son of the..."
links.text: "Ptolemy Pryce? He's the son of the old Pryce -- one of the founders of the RCM."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He's one of the most highly regard..."
links.text: "He's one of the most highly regarded men in the force. You're lucky."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Somewhere under the curved roof of..."
links.text: Somewhere under the curved roof of a former silk factory, shaped like a ladybird with two chimneys, Police Captain Ptolemy Pryce sits behind a heavy wooden desk. Resident medic Nix Gottlieb pours him coffee. It's silent in the captain's office...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "They speak of change. The city. The..."
links.text: They speak of change. The city. The tension on the streets. They speak of the events of April and the blood on the streets in May.

links.title: Cuno: ""Yeah, that shit is fucking famous..."
links.text: "Yeah, that shit is fucking famous on Channel 8. Cuno hears this shit."

links.title: You: ""Did we recently shoot up a church..."
links.text: "Did we recently shoot up a church by any chance?" (Point to the church.)

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""So he remembers *that*... Yes, the..."
links.text: "So he remembers *that*... Yes, there may have been a raid on *some* churches. It wasn't good press."

links.title: Trant Heidelstam: ""Shooting up churches never is. I w..."
links.text: "Shooting up churches never is. I was out of town, to be clear...."

links.title: You: ""What happened? Why did we need to..."
links.text: "What happened? Why did we need to go there?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Our *enemies* were hiding in *a* c..."
links.text: "Our *enemies* were hiding in *a* church -- to the best of our information. That's it. I'm not talking about this anymore. Your security clearance is *shit-tier* right now. You have to wait for it to go up."

links.title: Authority: "He means it. The RCM and its enemie..."
links.text: He means it. The RCM and its enemies will not be discussed on this coast.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Your clearance will not go up while..."
links.text: Your clearance will not go up while you're within earshot of the Union headquarters.

links.title: You: ""So I work in the Bloody Murder Sta..."
links.text: "So I work in the Bloody Murder Station?" (Conclude.)

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Okay -- it's not the Bloody Murder..."
links.text: "Okay -- it's not the Bloody Murder Station. It's an old converted silk mill with green desk lamps and a coffee corner. A lot of good people work there. Hard. Every day."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Jamrock is the largest ghetto in R..."
links.text: "Jamrock is the largest ghetto in Revachol. Faubourg, technically... but it's divided into *eleven* districts. Jamrock only has us."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The press will blow over," he says..."
links.text: "The press will blow over," he says in a reassuring tone. "Jamrock is lucky to have you. And it's often considered to be the greatest of the districts -- you're lucky to have it."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Thank you again, lieutenant.""
links.text: "Thank you again, lieutenant."

links.title: Cuno: ""Cuno's likin' this shit. Jamrock i..."
links.text: "Cuno's likin' this shit. Jamrock is the real shit -- Martinaise is fucking white as balls. Sea-shit. This ain't a real ghetto."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Thank you, Cuno. You bring light t..."
links.text: "Thank you, Cuno. You bring light to my day."

links.title: Cuno: ""What?! Bitches dream of the 41st...."
links.text: "What?! Bitches dream of the 41st. Why you think Cuno's *in* this shit? Word is it's fucking violent. Your Captain Pryce dusted like... a thousand people."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Thank you, Cuno," he says with an..."
links.text: "Thank you, Cuno," he says with an amused half-smile. "You're being kind. It's an understaffed station and the district is too big -- which is why we need to..." He tilts his head northward and clicks his tongue.

links.title: Judit Minot: ""... get back to it. We left Torson..."
links.text: "... get back to it. We left Torson and McLaine to run the C-Wing. It's not good."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""That's not true...""
links.text: "That's not true..."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Okay. It's an understaffed station..."
links.text: "Okay. It's an understaffed station where there's too much work, so we need to get back to it. It's not your problem anymore."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "A lowset house, windswept -- and wi..."
links.text: A lowset house, windswept -- and without you. Traffic whooshes by...

links.title: You: ""The phasmid -- I need to tell Lena..."
links.text: "The phasmid -- I need to tell Lena about this ASAP."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Who is Lena?""
links.text: "Who is Lena?"

links.title: Encyclopedia: "She lives at 1113 Tabernacle Road,..."
links.text: She lives at 1113 Tabernacle Road, in Jamrock. Remember?

links.title: You: ""A cryptozoologist. She lives in Ja..."
links.text: "A cryptozoologist. She lives in Jamrock, on Tabernacle road. She told me about this phasmid."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Tabernacle? It's on the way over...."
links.text: "Tabernacle? It's on the way over. Near where you live, on Perdition..." She looks at Vicquemare.

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Fine. If we're gonna drop you off..."
links.text: "Fine. If we're gonna drop you off anyway."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Well, good luck finding her once w..."
links.text: "Well, good luck finding her once we get back."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""She and her husband were conductin..."
links.text: "She and her husband were conducting the search for the phasmid. It's their discovery -- in part."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They should know as soon as possib..."
links.text: "They should know as soon as possible. It would do you good to deliver some positive news for a change."

links.title: Suggestion: "She is going to be over the moon."
links.text: She is going to be over the moon.

links.title: Endurance: "Watch out or she'll faint."
links.text: Watch out or she'll faint.

links.title: Suggestion: "She is going to be over the moon. I..."
links.text: She is going to be over the moon. It will do you good to deliver some *good* news to someone for a change.

links.title: You: ""No one. Forget it.""
links.text: "No one. Forget it."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Already did. Let's go?""
links.text: "Already did. Let's go?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Well, you can do that in all the s..."
links.text: "Well, you can do that in all the spare time you're going to have."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Jean..." She stops."
links.text: "Jean..." She stops.

links.title: You: ""She's a cryptozoologist. She told..."
links.text: "She's a cryptozoologist. She told me about this phasmid..."

links.title: Judit Minot: "She listens to you sadly. The wind..."
links.text: She listens to you sadly. The wind blows.

links.title: You: ""Lieutenant Kitsuragi -- what will..."
links.text: "Lieutenant Kitsuragi -- what will you do now?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well -- first I will go back to my..."
links.text: "Well -- first I will go back to my station and write the most detailed report anyone has ever seen. It will have to be good to cover all this. Then I will have a serious talk with my captain."

links.title: You: ""About what?""
links.text: "About what?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, we just stopped a small..."
links.text: "Detective, we just stopped a small-scale war. Something is happening to Revachol." He takes a look around -- into the deepening shadows of the streets -- then pulls up his collar.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't know what, yet -- but it's..."
links.text: "I don't know what, yet -- but it's going to be a hard spring for the RCM. We need to get ready. Infiltrate. Investigate."

links.title: Shivers: "Distant traffic. A scrap of newspap..."
links.text: Distant traffic. A scrap of newspaper drifts by, carried by the wind.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "It says: "Tensions rise in Terminal..."
links.text: It says: "Tensions rise in Terminal YC In light of the Débardeurs' strike in Terminal B, among representatives of heavy industry in Coal City..." you read.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Le Retour..."
links.text: Le Retour...

links.title: You: ""Wait, you mean The Return?""
links.text: "Wait, you mean The Return?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Perhaps..." He pauses, deep in tho..."
links.text: "Perhaps..." He pauses, deep in thought. "There are people who say the Zone of Control will not hold up long. They're not on the radio -- yet. But there are parties out there..."

links.title: Trant Heidelstam: ""Yes." His face darkens. "I hear wo..."
links.text: "Yes." His face darkens. "I hear worries -- from systems analysts in Vesper and Messina. International risks departments in banks. People like that."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""We've been hearing whispers in Jam..."
links.text: "We've been hearing whispers in Jamrock too. Ever since fall. I agree that something is happening. People are tense. I hear a fan spinning. Fast. Something is about to hit it."

links.title: You: ""Want to do that at Station 41?""
links.text: "Want to do that at Station 41?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Talk to Captain Pryce? I'd rather..."
links.text: "Talk to Captain Pryce? I'd rather not ruffle the feathers of *two* captains with my doom-mongering."

links.title: You: ""No, I meant *investigate*. Come wo..."
links.text: "No, I meant *investigate*. Come work in Precinct 41."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Work *with* Pryce?" A crooked smil..."
links.text: "Work *with* Pryce?" A crooked smile quivers on his lips. "I'm flattered, but I don't know if I..."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Would fit in? Am crazy enough? Can..."
links.text: Would fit in? Am crazy enough? Can take the stress? He doesn't know how to finish the sentence.

links.title: Rhetoric: "This truly came as a surprise to hi..."
links.text: This truly came as a surprise to him. Not a bad one. But he's at a loss.

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Flattered? You're Lieutenant Kitsu..."
links.text: "Flattered? You're Lieutenant Kitsuragi. *We* would be flattered if you even considered..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I would have to tie things up in G..."
links.text: "I would have to tie things up in GRIH first. But... I mean, whatever is coming -- Jamrock *will* be more central to it than the harbour." The lieutenant turns very serious all of a sudden.

links.title: Judit Minot: ""And we also have a huge case load,..."
links.text: "And we also have a huge case load, lieutenant," she says with a smile. "Piles that we need to get back to. Mountains, even."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I do like the sound of that..." He..."
links.text: "I do like the sound of that..." He returns her smile.

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's *really* considering it."
links.text: He's *really* considering it.

links.title: You: ""Yeah. Sure.""
links.text: "Yeah. Sure."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""He meant *join* us. At Precinct 41..."
links.text: "He meant *join* us. At Precinct 41. Transfer."

links.title: You: ""Good luck with your report.""
links.text: "Good luck with your report."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No -- good luck with *your* report..."
links.text: "No -- good luck with *your* report." The lieutenant smiles warmly.

links.title: Logic: "Dammit. Yes. *That*."
links.text: Dammit. Yes. *That*.

links.title: Volition: "We're looking at a real brick here...."
links.text: We're looking at a real brick here. The sooner you start the better.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, we just stopped a small..."
links.text: "Detective, we just stopped a small-scale war. Something is happening to Revachol." He pulls up his collar and looks around, the cold spring light reflected in the lenses of his glasses.

links.title: You: ""Cuno -- what will you do now?""
links.text: "Cuno -- what will you do now?"

links.title: Cuno: ""Fuck do you think? Gonna rock that..."
links.text: "Fuck do you think? Gonna rock that law enforcement shit with you guys -- Detective Cuno." He chews on a piece of imaginary chewing gum. "Like you promised."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Like you... promised?""
links.text: "Like you... promised?"

links.title: You: ""But I didn't promise anything.""
links.text: "But I didn't promise anything."

links.title: Cuno: ""You gonna *lie* after what we just..."
links.text: "You gonna *lie* after what we just been through? Let Cuno refresh you: Cuno said he'd take your crippled ass to the island, if you take Cuno to Jamrock. Boatman Cuno."

links.title: Drama: "I'm quite sure it wasn't like that,..."
links.text: I'm quite sure it wasn't like that, sire.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Perhaps it was an *unspoken* agreem..."
links.text: Perhaps it was an *unspoken* agreement between you and the junior officer?

links.title: You: ""Guys. Cuno's enrolling in a junior..."
links.text: "Guys. Cuno's enrolling in a junior officer program."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""No, he's not. He's twelve.""
links.text: "No, he's not. He's twelve."

links.title: Cuno: ""Cuno's fuckin' nineteen.""
links.text: "Cuno's fuckin' nineteen."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""You have to be *fifteen* for the j..."
links.text: "You have to be *fifteen* for the junior officer program -- you're not even that."

links.title: Cuno: ""Hey, f****t! You don't get it. Cun..."
links.text: "Hey, f****t! You don't get it. Cuno's got pig all over him -- Cuno smells of bacon grease. Been *seen* with you. Fuckin' informant shit. You think no one *sees* this?" He spreads his arms.

links.title: Cuno: ""They're gonna hang me by the nuts..."
links.text: "They're gonna hang me by the nuts if you leave me here. You want that on you? A dead kid?" He narrows his eyes. "Or you want Cuno at your station, solving shit? Like we *just* did."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""No, he's not. What is he, ten? Ele..."
links.text: "No, he's not. What is he, ten? Eleven?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah... no. You're staying here, C..."
links.text: "Yeah... no. You're staying here, Cuno. You're too young."

links.title: Cuno: ""THE FUCK?!" He spreads his arms. "..."
links.text: "THE FUCK?!" He spreads his arms. "Cuno's been *seen* with you, out in the open. He's free game right now. Singin' to the popophone. Fuckin' informant shit. Got pig all over me -- smoked pig."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""You're what? Ten? Eleven?""
links.text: "You're what? Ten? Eleven?"

links.title: Cuno: ""Cuno's fuckin' nineteen.""
links.text: "Cuno's fuckin' nineteen."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""You have to be *fifteen* for the j..."
links.text: "You have to be *fifteen* for the junior officer program -- and you are not."

links.title: Cuno: ""Hey, f****t! Understand this -- th..."
links.text: "Hey, f****t! Understand this -- they're gonna hang me by the nuts if you leave me here. You want that on you? A dead kid? *Or* you want the Cuno at your station, solving shit? Like we *just* did?"

links.title: Composure: "His hands are shaking and his face..."
links.text: His hands are shaking and his face is white.

links.title: Empathy: "He's genuinely scared of being left..."
links.text: He's genuinely scared of being left behind.

links.title: Inland Empire: "It's not the locals he's worried ab..."
links.text: It's not the locals he's worried about -- but an eleven year old girl.

links.title: You: "(Lower your voice.) "Jean, he has n..."
links.text: (Lower your voice.) "Jean, he has nothing."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""I know a hundred kids with nothing..."
links.text: "I know a hundred kids with nothing, Harry. We can't make them all cops."

links.title: Cuno: ""You don't have to make *them* cops..."
links.text: "You don't have to make *them* cops -- only Cuno. Cuno's an asset."

links.title: You: ""Jean. I want Cuno at our station,..."
links.text: "Jean. I want Cuno at our station, solving this shit."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""He can't be a cop, Harry. He's twe..."
links.text: "He can't be a cop, Harry. He's twelve. And he says 'f****t' every four seconds."

links.title: Cuno: ""I won't say it! I won't say it any..."
links.text: "I won't say it! I won't say it anymore."

links.title: Composure: "His teeth are clenched and his thro..."
links.text: His teeth are clenched and his throat moves in a gulping motion.

links.title: Trant Heidelstam: ""Maybe you can take the kid with yo..."
links.text: "Maybe you can take the kid with you," the special consultant says, looking at the boy. "Enrol him a year earlier and say he's fourteen. *If* he..."

links.title: Cuno: ""I promise I won't say it." He shak..."
links.text: "I promise I won't say it." He shakes his head so hard his face turns red. "I won't say any of it anymore."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Detective Kuuno de Ruyter."
links.text: Detective Kuuno de Ruyter.

links.title: Judit Minot: ""For god's sake..." She sighs. "Yes..."
links.text: "For god's sake..." She sighs. "Yes, we'll do it."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: "Another sigh -- of surrender."
links.text: Another sigh -- of surrender.

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""He can't be a cop, Harry. He's a c..."
links.text: "He can't be a cop, Harry. He's a child. A child who says 'f****t' every four seconds."

links.title: You: ""His dad's in a coma and his only f..."
links.text: "His dad's in a coma and his only friend is gone."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""I don't care -- he can't be a cop...."
links.text: "I don't care -- he can't be a cop. He's twelve. And says 'f****t' every four seconds."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""I don't care -- he can't be a cop...."
links.text: "I don't care -- he can't be a cop. He's just a kid. A kid who says 'f****t' every four seconds."

links.title: You: ""He was good. On the island. He can..."
links.text: "He was good. On the island. He can do this."

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry. We just can't. It's not..."
links.text: "I'm sorry. We just can't. It's not possible."

links.title: Cuno: ""Not POSSIBLE is me staying here. *..."
links.text: "Not POSSIBLE is me staying here. *Fucking* understand that. I'm not dying here, f****t. I'm coming with you."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""You can't be a cop. You're twelve...."
links.text: "You can't be a cop. You're twelve. And you say 'f****t' every four seconds."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""You can't be a cop. You're a child..."
links.text: "You can't be a cop. You're a child. And you say 'f****t' every four seconds."

links.title: You: ""I'm ready." (End.)"
links.text: "I'm ready." (End.)

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Good." She looks at you, then Vicq..."
links.text: "Good." She looks at you, then Vicquemare...

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Fuck it, let's go." The man points..."
links.text: "Fuck it, let's go." The man points down the street. "Trant brought his motor carriage. It's a 20 minute drive to Jamrock."

links.title: Shivers: "Under the night sky the great distr..."
links.text: Under the night sky the great district sleeps: A dark chessboard of wooden houses in the rain, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street glowing on the rainswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "You close your eyes and hear the do..."
links.text: You close your eyes and hear the dogs bark. A lone woman sits by a factory window, dreaming of meteorite strikes. On Rue Saint-Gérôme a square bullet slides into a square-shaped chamber. In Old South a man without eyelids smiles. Spring has come. It's time.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Torson?" "Yes." "McLaine?" "Yes.""
links.text:
"Torson?"
"Yes."
"McLaine?"
"Yes."
"Heidelstam?"
"No."
"Vicquemare?"
"Yes."
"Du Bois?"
"Of course."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Really?" Nix Gottlieb looks up fro..."
links.text:
"Really?" Nix Gottlieb looks up from the list. "I hear he's quite unstable."
"You say that like it's a *bad* thing," Captain Ptolemy Pryce points his pen at the doctor. It's dim in his office and the curtains are drawn. "Harry's our man, he'll pull through -- and when he does, he'll side with Revachol."
"Understood." Gottlieb returns to the list. "Minot?"
"Of course."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Wonderful," the woman looks north...."
links.text: "Wonderful," the woman looks north. "Then can we please just go back to Jamrock now?"

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Wonderful," the woman looks north...."
links.text: "Wonderful," the woman looks north. "Then can we please just go back to Jamrock now?"

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Wonderful," the woman looks north...."
links.text: "Wonderful," the woman looks north. "Then can we please just go back to Jamrock now?"

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Wonderful," the woman looks north...."
links.text: "Wonderful," the woman looks north. "Then can we please just go back to Jamrock now?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Torson?" "Yes." "McLaine?" "Yes.""
links.text:
"Torson?"
"Yes."
"McLaine?"
"Yes."
"Heidelstam?"
"No."
"Vicquemare?"
"Yes."
"Du Bois?"
"Yes."

links.title: Shivers: "Under the night sky the great distr..."
links.text: Under the night sky the great district sleeps: A dark chessboard of wooden houses in the rain, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street glowing on the rainswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the night sky the great distr..."
links.text: Under the night sky the great district sleeps: A chessboard of old wooden houses in the snow, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street glowing on the horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the night sky the great distr..."
links.text: Under the night sky the great district sleeps: A black chessboard of old wooden houses, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street forking into the darkened horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the evening sky the great dis..."
links.text: Under the evening sky the great district turns on its lights: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street disappearing into the rain on the horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the evening sky the great dis..."
links.text: Under the evening sky the great district turns on its lights: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street forking into the snowswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the evening sky the great dis..."
links.text: Under the evening sky the great district turns on its lights: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street forking into the dark horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "The great district hums in the fall..."
links.text: The great district hums in the falling rain: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Grand Couron, from Precinct 41 to Boogie Street forking into the rainswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "The great district hums in the slow..."
links.text: The great district hums in the slowly falling snow: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls and chimney stacks. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41. To Boogie Street forking into the white horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the afternoon sky the great d..."
links.text: Under the afternoon sky the great district hums: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls and chimney stacks. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41. To Boogie Street forking into the snowswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the violet morning sky the gr..."
links.text: Under the violet morning sky the great district wakes: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls and chimney stacks. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41. To Boogie Street forking into the rainswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the pink morning sky the grea..."
links.text: Under the pink morning sky the great district wakes: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls and chimney stacks. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41. To Boogie Street forking into the snowswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the violet morning sky the gr..."
links.text: Under the violet morning sky the great district wakes: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls and chimney stacks. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41. To Boogie Street forking into the glowing horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "The great district hums with the no..."
links.text: The great district hums with the noise of human habitation: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Grand Couron, from Precinct 41 to Boogie Street forking into the distant horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the night sky the great distr..."
links.text: Under the night sky the great district sleeps: A chessboard of old wooden houses in the snow, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street glowing on the horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the night sky the great distr..."
links.text: Under the night sky the great district sleeps: A black chessboard of old wooden houses, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street forking into the darkened horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the evening sky the great dis..."
links.text: Under the evening sky the great district turns on its lights: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street disappearing into the rain on the horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the evening sky the great dis..."
links.text: Under the evening sky the great district turns on its lights: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street forking into the snowswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the evening sky the great dis..."
links.text: Under the evening sky the great district turns on its lights: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls inside. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41 atop the motorway, to Boogie Street forking into the dark horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "The great district hums in the fall..."
links.text: The great district hums in the falling rain: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Grand Couron, from Precinct 41 to Boogie Street forking into the rainswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "The great district hums in the slow..."
links.text: The great district hums in the slowly falling snow: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls and chimney stacks. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41, to Boogie Street forking into the white horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the afternoon sky the great d..."
links.text: Under the afternoon sky the great district hums: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls and chimney stacks. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41, to Boogie Street forking into the snowswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the violet morning sky the gr..."
links.text: Under the violet morning sky the great district wakes: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls and chimney stacks. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41, to Boogie Street forking into the rainswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the pink morning sky the grea..."
links.text: Under the pink morning sky the great district wakes: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls and chimney stacks. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41, to Boogie Street forking into the snowswept horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "Under the violet morning sky the gr..."
links.text: Under the violet morning sky the great district wakes: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls and chimney stacks. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Precinct 41, to Boogie Street forking into the glowing horizon...

links.title: Shivers: "The great district hums with the no..."
links.text: The great district hums with the noise of human habitation: A chessboard of wooden houses, 80,000 living souls. Firetraps as far as the eye can see -- from Main Street to Grand Couron, from Precinct 41 to Boogie Street forking into the distant horizon...

links.title: You: ""I'm ready." (End.)"
links.text: "I'm ready." (End.)

links.title: You: ""I'm ready." (End.)"
links.text: "I'm ready." (End.)

links.title: You: ""I'm ready." (End.)"
links.text: "I'm ready." (End.)

links.title: You: ""Good bye, then." (End.)"
links.text: "Good bye, then." (End.)

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Good bye, Harry. And -- I know it..."
links.text: "Good bye, Harry. And -- I know it won't happen, but..." He looks at you, heart steeled and eyes cold.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Even now -- you're his colleague."
links.text: Even now -- you're his colleague.

links.title: Shivers: "A grey rain falls on Martinaise. Th..."
links.text: A grey rain falls on Martinaise. The city soaks in it, cold and dripping. Waves hit the concrete breakers. The homeless huddle by the fires behind the fences. There, among the shacks, is your home. Stay. Have a drink. Forever.

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""*If* you make it -- if you've been..."
links.text: "*If* you make it -- if you've been sober for 10 months -- tell us. I'll work with you again. But not like this. Never like this again. This is over."

links.title: You: ""The collection of FALN sportswear..."
links.text: "The collection of FALN sportswear I've amassed..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The fact that you don't seem to *k..."
links.text: "The fact that you don't seem to *know* what homo-sexuality is..."

links.title: Endurance: "The *incredible* stamina output..."
links.text: The *incredible* stamina output...

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Also -- *this* guy. Just... everyth..."
links.text: Also -- *this* guy. Just... everything about this guy.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "And this guy too."
links.text: And this guy too.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "God... even this javelin-throwing f..."
links.text: God... even this javelin-throwing freak here...

links.title: You: ""Oh god -- *Contact Mike*...""
links.text: "Oh god -- *Contact Mike*..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course! Contact Mike!""
links.text: "Of course! Contact Mike!"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""He's been on about Mike again?" Th..."
links.text: "He's been on about Mike again?" The detective shakes his head. "I hate that guy."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""You've been on about Mike again?"..."
links.text: "You've been on about Mike again?" The detective shakes his head. "I hate that guy."

links.title: You: ""Contact Mike is a reprise of the m..."
links.text: "Contact Mike is a reprise of the most inspiring basic sporting principle of open competition! A 5,000-1 rank outsider!"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Oh -- you don't say?" He arches an..."
links.text: "Oh -- you don't say?" He arches an eyebrow. "Does he also *vault an impassible gulf of finance and privilege*?"

links.title: Judit Minot: ""It is... it *is* getting cold out...."
links.text: "It is... it *is* getting cold out..." She looks around -- at the dilapidated fishing village.

links.title: You: ""When was this? When was I a gym te..."
links.text: "When was this? When was I a gym teacher?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""In your twenties or late twenties...."
links.text: "In your twenties or late twenties. You've really let yourself go since then." He looks you over.

links.title: You: ""You said in Couron? I was a gym te..."
links.text: "You said in Couron? I was a gym teacher there?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Yes, you *taught gym* in Couron. I..."
links.text: "Yes, you *taught gym* in Couron. I believe that's the term? Taught gym at a high school. You were a high school gym teacher."

links.title: Perception (Smell): "The smell of sweat and glue, the wo..."
links.text: The smell of sweat and glue, the worn floorboards...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Couron is just east of Jamrock. It..."
links.text: Couron is just east of Jamrock. It was a short walk, every morning -- to the baseball field or the sports building...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""High school. Harry! Your goings-on..."
links.text: "High school. Harry! Your goings-on with Cuno, Andre, Acele -- the whole thing on the ice. That's why you're so *juvie*."

links.title: Empathy: "His smirk suggests barely contained..."
links.text: His smirk suggests barely contained laughter.

links.title: You: ""Why did I join the RCM then?""
links.text: "Why did I join the RCM then?"

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""The regular -- you found some chic..."
links.text: "The regular -- you found some chick. She inspired you to fight the *big fight*. Be more than you are. All that."

links.title: Inland Empire: "You, every morning, walking from Vo..."
links.text: You, every morning, walking from Voyager Road to teach gym. She -- leaving for the academy with her spring coat on. The air filled with the smell of smoke and raspberries and incredible hope. An ocean full of hope.

links.title: You: ""Okay. I see now." (Conclude.)"
links.text: "Okay. I see now." (Conclude.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I knew it. I knew no normal human..."
links.text: "I knew it. I knew no normal human being can run like that. He's an-honest-to-god gym teacher."

links.title: Cuno: ""Cuno fucking *knew* there had to b..."
links.text: "Cuno fucking *knew* there had to be something wrong if you can run like that..."

links.title: Endurance: "The raw, robust stamina output..."
links.text: The raw, robust stamina output...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Some of your more, khm, *old-schoo..."
links.text: "Some of your more, khm, *old-school* social views..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Your love of *retro-style* dance m..."
links.text: "Your love of *retro-style* dance music. How you're able to perform a 360-degree spin-kick..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Your moves on the church floor --..."
links.text: "Your moves on the church floor -- which, honestly, were just *jump aerobics*. Your use of the word *graffito*..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Some of your more, khm, *old-schoo..."
links.text: "Some of your more, khm, *old-school* wording choices. Your posture even. The constant *stretches*..."

links.title: You: ""How I can keep going for *twelve h..."
links.text: "How I can keep going for *twelve hours* a day..."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Honestly -- anything that ends thi..."
links.text: "Honestly -- anything that ends this *trial* is okay with me." A quick nod.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "But he's been drinking, she thinks...."
links.text: But he's been drinking, she thinks. This is exactly how he gets out of this every time. It's bad for him, but...

dialogueTree.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""No." There's a silence. "Sure, you..."
dialogueTree.text: "No." There's a silence. "Sure, you got the case together -- you can *do* policework -- in bouts. That's not a surprise to me."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Even the insect -- I don't care. B..."
links.text: "Even the insect -- I don't care. But you're an *alcoholic*. And you've been drinking -- again. I won't let my life unravel because of this."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Jean -- I think he hasn't. I can s..."
links.text: "Jean -- I think he hasn't. I can see it on his face..."

links.title: Endurance: "The bloating *has* gone down since..."
links.text: The bloating *has* gone down since you woke up that morning...

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Okay, so he's stayed clear for wha..."
links.text: "Okay, so he's stayed clear for what? A week?" He sighs.

links.title: Judit Minot: ""He has... That's true.""
links.text: "He has... That's true."

links.title: Empathy: "There's an enormous sadness in that..."
links.text: There's an enormous sadness in that admission.

links.title: Trant Heidelstam: ""It's tough. One of the toughest ad..."
links.text: "It's tough. One of the toughest addictions to overcome. Comparable *only* to heavy synthetic opiates. Even morphine is easier to kick than alcohol -- statistically. The odds are against him. Especially at his age."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: "He nods. "He's too old. He's been l..."
links.text: He nods. "He's too old. He's been like this for too long. I've seen him try many times. It's a farce by now."

links.title: Suggestion: "They're leaving. They're all turnin..."
links.text: They're leaving. They're all turning away from you.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "No. You can figure it out. *Replace..."
links.text: No. You can figure it out. *Replace* it! Replace the alcohol with amphetamine. Or GBL! Fuck it -- morphine! Graffito removal agent! Anything. It'll buy you time. All you need is time.

links.title: Volition: "No. You *can* stop. Just wade throu..."
links.text: No. You *can* stop. Just wade through the hell. Month after month. Year after year -- you against the nothingness. It's possible, because *time* is possible.

links.title: Conceptualization: "If you declare your life forfeit; i..."
links.text: If you declare your life forfeit; if you declare yourself a doomed man... A doomed man does not need comfort. From *anything*. He can go on without drink, or help. Like a clockwork.

links.title: Empathy: "For the world."
links.text: For the world.

links.title: Rhetoric: "For Revachol."
links.text: For Revachol.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Compared to the intersection, in fr..."
links.text: Compared to the intersection, in front of Video Revachol 24 -- it's nothing. Compared to that, everything is possible.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Think! You can *detect*. In Jamrock..."
links.text: Think! You can *detect*. In Jamrock. Boogie Street. Couron. Le Royaume, underground. Coal City. On the 8/81-- it will all be yours to sieve through when the last snow has melted.

links.title: Shivers: "Stop and you can go to the Burnt Ou..."
links.text: Stop and you can go to the Burnt Out Quarter. And meet me there -- wafting above the burnt ruins. Like the smell of caramel -- Le Retour is waiting.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "And Station 41 and the glow of its..."
links.text: And Station 41 and the glow of its desk lamps, the clicking of coffee mugs, clouds of cigarette smoke and the ringing telephone... your youth. There is still a way back.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "The houses, the streets, the motorw..."
links.text: The houses, the streets, the motorways singing. Hold on. This is a fight we can *win*.

links.title: You: ""I can -- I will just pass time unt..."
links.text: "I can -- I will just pass time until my mind reconfigures from the abuse it's taken. I can do that now. I've taught myself."

links.title: Cuno: ""Listen to this shit, man..." He th..."
links.text: "Listen to this shit, man..." He throws up his hands.

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Detective." She looks at Vicquemar..."
links.text: "Detective." She looks at Vicquemare. "I just don't want this *trial* to go on any longer. It's cold outside, and... let's just go."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Fucking Harry... Fuck you for brin..."
links.text: "Fucking Harry... Fuck you for bringing this kid with you. It's *only* because he's defending you -- it's the *only* reason you're not staying here to die."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It's more than that. He just can't...."
links.text: It's more than that. He just can't. One final time...

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""You manipulative son of a bitch......"
links.text: "You manipulative son of a bitch..." He shakes his head and sniffles. "It *is* cold, and we have vehicles in the square. The perp needs to be taken into custody. Let's get a move on."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""Detective." She looks at Vicquemar..."
links.text: "Detective." She looks at Vicquemare. "I just don't want this *trial* to go on any longer. It's cold outside, and..."

links.title: Trant Heidelstam: "He slowly nods."
links.text: He slowly nods.

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""You manipulative fuck... Fine. It'..."
links.text: "You manipulative fuck... Fine. It's cold and we have vehicles in the square. And the perp needs to be taken into custody too -- let's get a move on."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""No. We're done, Harry. You're drun..."
links.text: "No. We're done, Harry. You're drunk. You'll get a station call once you've sobered up."

links.title: Judit Minot: ""...""
Trant Heidelstam: ""...""
Esprit de Corps: "No one knows what to say. But they..."
links.text: No one knows what to say. But they agree. Keeping you on the force endangers civilians.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The farce needs to end. Everyone se..."
links.text: The farce needs to end. Everyone sees that.

links.title: You: ""Wait. I have a *few* questions bef..."
links.text: "Wait. I have a *few* questions before you go. About who I am..."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""About who you *are*?""
links.text: "About who you *are*?"

links.title: You: ""Okay then. Fuck it. I have a shack..."
links.text: "Okay then. Fuck it. I have a shack here. I don't need you all."

links.title: Jean Vicquemare: ""Don't pity yourself. You've manage..."
links.text: "Don't pity yourself. You've managed not to die thus far. You'll manage now."

links.title: You: ""I'll just go back to the island an..."
links.text: "I'll just go back to the island and *live* there. I don't care."

links.title: You: ""Good bye then. I'll just become a..."
links.text: "Good bye then. I'll just become a bum now. A bum cop."

links.title: You: ""My life is forfeit. All I'm good f..."
links.text: "My life is forfeit. All I'm good for is this work. I *will* quit."

links.title: You: ""I need to be the greatest, Jean. I..."
links.text: "I need to be the greatest, Jean. I was *born* for this. I *will* stop. To be better."

links.title: You: ""I know it's difficult to believe,..."
links.text: "I know it's difficult to believe, but I will do it. For the white banner of the Commune."

links.title: You: ""I'm not that person anymore. I bec..."
links.text: "I'm not that person anymore. I became something else and that something else *will* quit."

links.title: You: ""I'm not that person anymore. I bec..."
links.text: "I'm not that person anymore. I became something else. And that something else *has* quit."

links.title: You: ""I will win, Jean. I swear to god a..."
links.text: "I will win, Jean. I swear to god and to Revachol, I will win."

links.title: You: ""I cannot. I cannot live without th..."
links.text: "I cannot. I cannot live without this job... fuck you then! And fuck me! I'll go."

links.title: Rhetoric: "For the planetary proletariat."
links.text: For the planetary proletariat.

links.title: Rhetoric: "For the Revachol Citizens Militia...."
links.text: For the Revachol Citizens Militia. A blue forget-me-not in the grey sky.

links.title: Rhetoric: "For revenge."
links.text: For revenge.
